curvefitting module¶

curvefitting.add_secondary_palette(palette, secondary, parameter_sets)¶
curvefitting.extra_state(func, y, t, params)¶
curvefitting.flatten_tspan(tspan)¶
curvefitting.get(nested_dict, first_key, second_key, no_result=None)¶
curvefitting.get_SSE(y_data, y_model, sd_dataset=1)¶
curvefitting.get_SSE_data(data, models, params={}, t_indices={}, params_array=array([], dtype=float64), params_index={})¶

Calculates SSE for data against models and returns the negative of the SSE. For testing/single calls:

  1. Supply the parameters as a dict. Ignore all other optional arguments.

For iterative calls:

  1. Ignore the params argument.

  2. Provide a numpy array of parameters instead.

  3. Use the function get_liklihood_args to set up the other arguments.

curvefitting.get_SSE_dataset(model_num, data, models, params, t_indices)¶
curvefitting.get_indices(t_data, t_model)¶
curvefitting.get_indices_dataset(dataset, model)¶
curvefitting.get_likelihood_args(data, models, params)¶

Meant to be used with get_SSE. Accepts data, models and a dict of params to generate the remaining arguments for get_SSE.

Note: Actual values of the params do not matter. Only the order.

curvefitting.get_params_for_model(models, trace, model_num, row_index)¶
curvefitting.get_t_indices(data, models)¶
curvefitting.get_tspan(model)¶
curvefitting.make_AX(plot_index={}, data={})¶

Generates a dictionary of axes objects using either plot_index OR data.

curvefitting.make_colors(palette, models={}, data={}, parameter_sets=0)¶
curvefitting.make_palette(n=0, model={}, dataset={}, palette_type='color', **kwargs)¶
curvefitting.plot(posterior={}, guess={}, models={}, data={}, data_sd={}, plot_index={}, titles={}, labels={}, legend_args={}, figs=[], AX={}, palette='color', line_args={'linewidth': 1.5}, guess_palette='white')¶

Wrapper for plotting function for data, guess and posterior in one function call.
